page.title: 12PLAYGROUND GAMES1, GATESHEAD
page.content: Some games are universal and have changed little over hundreds of years. The following are a selection of games played by the children at St.Mary's C.E. Infants/Nursery School. {RING A RING A ROSES}The aim of the game is to skip around singing in a ring and all fall down together at the end. The game originates from the{ {Great Plague of London}.The circle represents the rash, the pocket full of posies the herbs carried to ward off infection and atishoo the sneeze which was the final and fatal symptom before death. {HOPSCOTCH}This has been played since the days of the{Romans}.You need a stone and a bay marked with numbers. The stone is thrown onto a number. You hop and jump up the bay and back again to pick up the stone.If you land on a line you are out.
